message: I looked through the docs but I can't seem to find information on what these two settings should be set too. On self hosted deployments it's a no brainer. What are these two directories on ep.io?
I suppose running `python manage.py collectstatic` before-hand shouldn't be an issue.

Its up to you :-) If its any help, I store my static files in with my app. under static/
I store my media files in EPIO_DATA_DIRECTORY (environment variable of path to a writeable file system)
MEDIA_ROOT = os.path.join(os.getenv('EPIO_DATA_DIRECTORY',PROJECT_DIR), 'media')
STATIC_ROOT = os.path.join(PROJECT_DIR, 'static/')
Thanks! This most def does help. I was under the impression that the project root once uploaded was was read-only.

The project root is ready-only. But there is ../data (EPIO_DATA_DIRECTORY) which is writeable :-)
I have no need to write to my static directory post upload, so keep it in the read-only storage. Media is another case though!
@glenbot yes, collectstatic can be done beforehand
and, as dangerfield said, there's a writable directory (docs here: https://www.ep.io/docs/runtime/#filesystem)

dnagerfields method is working for me, i see the files in the ../data directory, however when I try to view them in my browser I get a 404. im using "import settings" and "(r'^media/(?P<path>.*)$', 'django.views.static.serve',{'document_root': settings.MEDIA_ROOT})," in my urls.py which works fine in development but not on ep.io. in my production_settings.py i have "MEDIA_ROOT = os.getenv('EPIO_DATA_DIRECTORY')" and i have "MEDIA_URL = '/media/'" in my settings.py only. any ideas? thanks.
@tomvon the static.serve view isn't suitable for development; add a section in epio.ini with [static] /media = ../data/
